channel.title: Master command
channel.description:
Ok yo the guy with the messy command . when i use ur master thing. i cant use ::update or ::coords
anyways
pi source 317 mtp 2
I want a master command that gives att,str,def,range,mage,hp. not prayer
any 1 got command

item.description:
@_John wrote:

You probably added brackets wrong.

item.title: Master command
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“sonsofgod2, post:7, topic:370539”]Buddy that levels everryhing to 99. i want only those 6. no prayer. jesus

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master") && c.playerRights >= 2) {        if (c.inWild())        return;        for (int j = 0; j < 21; j++) {                c.playerXP[j] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;                c.playerLevel[j] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[j]);                c.getPA().refreshSkill(j);        }}

Use mine. It’s messy but will work.

[quote=“n10si t, post:2, topic:370539”]Erm…

Here:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master")) {
					if (c.inWild())
					return;
				c.playerXP[0] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[0] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[0]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(0);
				c.playerXP[1] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[1] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[1]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(1);
				c.playerXP[2] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[2] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[2]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(2);
				c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
				c.playerXP[4] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[4] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[4]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(4);
				c.playerXP[6] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[6] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[6]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(6);

I believe that’s what you want. Messy, but it’ll work.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Master command
item.dc:creator: @sonsofgod2 sonsofgod2
item.description:
@sonsofgod2 wrote:

Buddy that levels everryhing to 99. i want only those 6. no prayer. jesus

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master") && c.playerRights >= 2) {        if (c.inWild())        return;        for (int j = 0; j < 21; j++) {                c.playerXP[j] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;                c.playerLevel[j] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[j]);                c.getPA().refreshSkill(j);        }}

item.title: Master command
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:4, topic:370539”][quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=466641.msg3412630#msg3412630 date=1290818028]

Erm…

Here:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master")) {
					if (c.inWild())
					return;
				c.playerXP[0] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[0] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[0]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(0);
				c.playerXP[1] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[1] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[1]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(1);
				c.playerXP[2] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[2] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[2]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(2);
				c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
				c.playerXP[4] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[4] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[4]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(4);
				c.playerXP[6] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[6] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[6]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(6);

I believe that’s what you want. Messy, but it’ll work.

Ew

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master") && c.playerRights >= 2) { if (c.inWild()) return; for (int j = 0; j < 21; j++) { c.playerXP[j] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[j] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[j]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(j); } }
[/quote]

Shut up :rolleyes:

Btw, he only wants the command to give him 99 Attack, Defence, Strength, HP, Range, and Magic, not anything else.
So idk if the whole “int j” stuff will work.[/quote]

Just because he doesn’t want every skill doesn’t mean a for loop isn’t effective.

Read full topic

item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:3, topic:370539”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=466641.msg3412628#msg3412628 date=1290817857]
Erm…

Here:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master")) {
					if (c.inWild())
					return;
				c.playerXP[0] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[0] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[0]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(0);
				c.playerXP[1] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;

				c.getPA().refreshSkill(1);
				c.playerXP[2] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[2] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[2]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(2);
				c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
				c.playerXP[4] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[4] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[4]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(4);
				c.playerXP[6] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
				c.playerLevel[6] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[6]);
				c.getPA().refreshSkill(6);

I believe that’s what you want. Messy, but it’ll work.
[/quote]

Ew

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master") && c.playerRights >= 2) { if (c.inWild()) return; for (int j = 0; j < 21; j++) { c.playerXP[j] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[j] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[j]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(j); } }[/quote]

Shut up :rolleyes:

Btw, he only wants the command to give him 99 Attack, Defence, Strength, HP, Range, and Magic, not anything else.
So idk if the whole “int j” stuff will work.
